newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh cenbank moves taka lower against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh cenbank moves taka lower against dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh Bank has set the taka currency lower against the U.S. dollar at 44.45/65 from 44.00/20 effective Monday, the central bank said in a release on Sunday.

The bank gave no reason for its decision to depreciate the take by over one percent. This is the second time the currency has been moved lower since fiscal 1997/98 began on July 1. The previous adjustment came on July 21.
Officials at commercial banks said the move was aimed at boosting the country's exports in view of dwindling foreign exchange reserves.

Reserves stood at $1.62 billion at the end of July, down from $1.99 billion a year ago. The officials said Bangladesh was under pressure from the International Monetary Fund to devalue its currency to stay competitive in international trade and boost reserves.
